poem:
Title: "In the Blank Space of Twenty-Two Minutes"

Unraveling on the quiet London stage,
A poignant tale hiccupped into existence.
An eerie chess match where innocent pawns bled,
A boy-king silenced in fatal resistance.

In the hollow echo of dial tones,
Fire, smoke, and shockingly blue dismay.
One man's dance razed the world's innocence,
In the quicksilver spill of twenty-two ballets.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How the fatal Hainault stabbing attack unfolded It only took about 22 minutes between police receiving the first 999 call about a man wielding a sword in a quiet suburb of east London and him being fired at with a Taser and arrested. But in that brief period, a 14-year-old boy was fatally stabbed, and four other people, including two police officers, were injured. Police described the events of Tuesday morning, near Hainault tube station,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
